alert.note: Alert for Cape Decision to Salisbury Sound Coastal Area; Cape Fairweather to Cape Suckling Coastal Area; Eastern Baranof Island and Southern Admiralty Island; Eastern Chichagof Island; Glacier Bay; Haines Borough and Lynn Canal; Inner Channels from Kupreanof Island to Etolin Island; Juneau Borough and Northern Admiralty Island; Salisbury Sound to Cape Fairweather Coastal Area (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 17 at 5:22PM AKDT by NWS Juneau
info.description: ...RIVER LEVELS ON THE RISE... The atmospheric river moving through the area Wednesday has caused rivers to rise from 0.5 to 2 inches of rainfall. The heavy rain is currently over the central panhandle, but is starting to diminish. Up to 0.5 inches of additional rainfall is expected through the evening over the central panhandle. Area rivers and streams are currently slowly rising or have crested and begun dropping this evening. Most are expected to remain in their banks and are expected to crest overnight below bankfull stage. Please see the relevant statements for the river that have experienced flooding today. The heavy precipitation will move out of the area Wednesday evening as the system slides to the southeast. For Chilkat River at Klukwan: At 4:00pm the stage was 126.05 feet. Flood Stage is 128.0 feet. Forecast: A crest around 126.5 feet is expected around 10:00pm Wednesday. For Indian River at Sitka: At 4:00pm the stage was 22.8 feet. Flood Stage is 25.5 feet. Forecast: The river crested around 23.8 ft around 2 pm Wed and is expected to continue to drop. For Mendenhall Lake : At 4:00pm the stage was 7.3 feet. Flood Stage is 9.0 feet. Forecast: A crest around 7.75 feet is expected around 10:00pm Wednesday.
